Name: The Beast
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Two lift hills (110' & 141' drops); 540° banked helix tunnel finale; three tunnels total; 35 acres of terrain; reprofiled first drop to 53°
Records & Awards: World's longest wooden coaster (7,361'); Golden Ticket Awards perennial top 10; $3.5M cost in 1979 ($20M+ today)

Name: Mystic Timbers
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 16 airtime hills; 'What's in the Shed?' mystery finale; Millennium Flyer articulated trains; 330K board-ft of lumber; 88K bolts
Records & Awards: Best New Ride 2017 (Golden Ticket Awards); gave KI most wooden track of any park (18,804')

Name: The Bat
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Cars swing freely side-to-side; originally 'Top Gun' (1993–2007); last Arrow suspended coaster still operating in US
Records & Awards: One of only a few remaining Arrow suspended coasters worldwide

Name: Backlot Stunt Coaster
Special Elements & Notable Facts: LIM electromagnetic launch; themed to movie car chase; fire & water effects along track; formerly 'Italian Job: Stunt Track'

Name: The Racer
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Dual-track racing coaster (both tracks ~3,415'); PTC trains; helped launch modern coaster renaissance; featured in Brady Bunch episode (1973)
Records & Awards: Credited with sparking the modern roller coaster boom of the 1970s

Name: Woodstock Express
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Family/kiddie coaster; originally 'Scooby-Doo' (1972); Peanuts-themed; great first coaster for young riders

Name: Rock 'n' Roller Coaster
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 0–57 mph in 2.8 sec (LSM launch); fully enclosed/dark; 900+ onboard speakers; Aerosmith soundtrack; serpent roll + corkscrew
Records & Awards: First Disney coaster with inversions; first Disney coaster with a launch; being re-themed to Muppets

Name: Seven Dwarfs Mine Train
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Cars swing side-to-side independently; animatronic dwarfs in mine scenes; family-friendly; New Fantasyland centerpiece

Name: Slinky Dog Dash
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Two LSM launches; Toy Story Land centerpiece; themed as Andy's Mega Coaster Kit; family-friendly; outdoor layout

Name: Expedition Everest
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Forward & backward sections via track switch; 22-ft Yeti animatronic ('Disco Yeti'); 199.5' mountain structure; $100M cost; 6 trains
Records & Awards: Most expensive coaster ever built ($100M) until Hagrid's 2019; tallest structure at WDW (199.5')

Name: The Barnstormer
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Goofy's barnyard theme; family/kiddie coaster; short but fun first coaster for young kids; Storybook Circus area

Name: Big Thunder Mountain Railroad
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Runaway mine train theme; three lift hills; elaborate Western desert theming; animatronic animals & effects; 'wildest ride in the wilderness'
Records & Awards: Classic Disney E-ticket attraction since 1980

Name: Guardians of the Galaxy: Cosmic Rewind
Special Elements & Notable Facts: World's first reverse-launch Disney coaster; Omnicoaster vehicles rotate 360° to face action; indoor ride; randomized soundtrack (5+ songs)
Records & Awards: World's longest fully enclosed coaster (4,769'); first coaster at EPCOT

Name: Blue Ridge Mountain Coaster
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Rider-controlled braking; individual sleds; scenic mountain descent; Great Smoky Mountains setting

Name: Woodstock Express
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Family/kiddie coaster; Peanuts-themed; great first coaster for young riders

Name: Fury 325
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 81° first drop; hornet theme; teal/lime track, white supports; crosses NC/SC state line; 2,700 tons of steel; 8.4 acres; camelback hills + double helix
Records & Awards: World's tallest giga coaster (325'); #1 Steel Coaster (Golden Ticket Awards since 2016); Best New Ride 2015

Name: Thunder Striker
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Formerly 'Intimidator' (Dale Earnhardt theme removed 2024); 74° first drop; multiple airtime hills; B&M hyper trains; open-air seating
Records & Awards: Originally named after NASCAR legend Dale Earnhardt; renamed 2024 after license expired

Name: Carolina Cyclone
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 2 vertical loops + 2 barrel rolls; Arrow classic looper; one of earliest 4-inversion coasters; 1980s steel classic
Records & Awards: One of the first coasters ever built with 4 inversions

Name: Ricochet
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Sharp 90° hairpin turns; small cars; sudden drops; compact layout; family-friendly thrill

Name: Montu
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 7 inversions: 104' vertical loop, Immelmann, zero-G roll, batwing, 60' loop, corkscrew; feet-dangling; Egypt-themed; navy blue track
Records & Awards: First coaster with an Immelmann loop; world's tallest/fastest inverted at opening (1996); 7 inversions ties record for inverted coasters

Name: SheiKra
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 90° vertical first drop (200'); holding brake pauses train at top; Immelmann inversion; 138' second drop into underground tunnel; splashdown finale; converted to floorless 2007
Records & Awards: First dive coaster in the US; first floorless dive coaster (2007 retrofit)

Name: Iron Gwazi
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 91° beyond-vertical first drop; 12 airtime moments; RMC I-Box steel track on wooden structure; converted from Gwazi wooden coaster; delayed 2 yrs by COVID
Records & Awards: North America's tallest hybrid coaster (206'); steepest drop on a hybrid (91°); first beyond-vertical hybrid drop

Name: Kumba
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 7 inversions: 114' vertical loop (wraps lift hill), dive loop, zero-G roll, cobra roll, 2 interlocking corkscrews; 'Kumba' means 'roar' in Kikongo
Records & Awards: First coaster with a dive loop; first with interlocking corkscrews; tallest vertical loop when opened (1993); Golden Ticket top 50 every year since 1998

Name: Phoenix Rising
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Family-friendly inverted coaster; feet-dangling; replaced Sand Serpent; Pantopia area; accessible to younger riders (42" with companion)
Records & Awards: North America's tallest & longest family inverted coaster at opening

Name: Tigris
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Triple-launch forward & backward; heartline roll inversion; 150' beyond-vertical spike; compact footprint; launched shuttle-style

Name: Cheetah Hunt
Special Elements & Notable Facts: Three LSM launches (35/60/40 mph); heartline roll; figure-8 element; trenches over water; cheetah theme with adjacent live cheetah exhibit
Records & Awards: Park's longest ride at 4,429'; features iconic figure-8 track element

Name: Mako
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 9 airtime moments; hammerhead turn; open-air B&M hyper trains; mako shark theme; 200' first drop; Orlando's signature hyper
Records & Awards: Orlando's tallest, fastest & longest coaster at opening (2016)

Name: Pipeline: The Surf Coaster
Special Elements & Notable Facts: World's first surf coaster; standing/surfboard-position seats that pitch forward dynamically; wave-themed elements; 1 inversion
Records & Awards: World's first B&M Surf Coaster model

Name: Kraken
Special Elements & Notable Facts: 7 inversions; floorless trains (no floor beneath riders' feet); sea monster theme; zero-G roll, cobra roll, vertical loops, corkscrews; formerly had VR overlay (2017–18, removed)
Records & Awards: First floorless coaster in the Southeast US at opening
